image.altText: A man on a bike with a baby sleep in the front seat, a fire behind them

props.synopsis: When fires roared through the Pacific Palisades neighbourhood of Los Angeles, Joel House only had a pushbike to get himself and his young daughter out of the path of the blaze.

title.children: Australian dad escaped LA fires with his toddler on his bike

image.altText: A firefighter cleans a car covered with fire retardant after the Palisades Fire at the Mandeville Canyon

props.synopsis: Firefighters are battling three separate wildfires that have killed at least 24 people in Los Angeles. Follow live.

title.children: LA makes 'urgent preparations' as dangerous winds pick back up

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Aussie expat says situation in LA 'completely indescribable'
'Hurricane force winds' could spark further flare ups

image.altText: An old white man speaks wearing a suit and yellow/blue tie in front of a gaudy painting

props.synopsis: The US president says negotiations to release Israeli hostages held by Hamas and end the war in Gaza are almost complete.

title.children: Gaza ceasefire deal in final stages of negotation, Biden says

image.altText: Roulette wheel, photo from Federal Group's Wrest Point casino website Tasmania.

props.synopsis: At casinos, the odds are never in a punter's favour. Now the chances of losing it all have been turned back onto one of Australia's biggest casino operators. How did the company get to this point?

title.children: Casino operator Star 'on its knees' as analyst predicts collapse

image.altText: A close up photo of a couple. The man has grey hair and a grey beard and the woman has long brown hair and glasses.

props.synopsis: Stuart and Vikki Guy say they had recently cancelled the contents insurance on their home after their total home and contents bill went from $1,800 to $6,000.

title.children: Couple who ditched contents insurance after shock bill lose house in fire

image.altText: Coco Gauff, Frances Tiafoe, Harriet Dart composite

props.synopsis: Lucky losers Francesco Passaro and Harriet Dart enjoy their day out, while Frances Tiafoe just loses his lunch. Here's the five quick hits from the Australian Open, including who is playing on day three.

title.children: Australian Open quick hits: Lucky losers win and winners lose their lunch

image.altText: Nick Kyrgios waves to the crowd

props.synopsis: After a two-year hiatus, the greatest show in tennis was back as Nick Kyrgios took to the court. It provided scenes that neither the player nor his adoring fans will ever forget.

title.children: Kyrgios proves his love affair with fans is like no other

image.altText: Australian currency notes and coins scattered

props.synopsis: For months, there has been a never-ending series of excuses for why interest rates can't be trimmed, even just a touch. Now some are whipping up a frenzy about a new apparent danger — a plummeting currency.

title.children: The Australian dollar is under pressure but we're in good company

image.altText: A graphic showing a young boy looking up at an illustration of a brain

props.synopsis: England, the US and Canada are among the countries with national autism strategies — and now Australia has one too.

title.children: Here's what's in Australia's new national autism strategy

image.altText: Firebombing plane drops fire retardant on a fire

props.synopsis: Firefighting aircraft have been soaring through the skies over Los Angeles in recent days as fires have ravaged the city. When it comes to disasters of its own, Australia has about 500 aircraft it can call on.

title.children: LA is burning, so how well prepared is Australia's aerial firefighting fleet?

image.altText: A drone shot of the Whyalla pellet plant.

props.synopsis: While the steelmaking city of Whyalla is no stranger to struggle, the latest crisis is taking a severe toll on the population, who very much want to continue making steel for Australia but say they are "sick of having to be resilient".

title.children: In Australia's iron triangle, the steelmaking city is battling to survive

image.altText: Ukrainian soldiers standing next to a firing Howitzer artillery gun.

props.synopsis: Russian forces have been making steady territorial gains in Ukraine's east, amid reports of fatigue and strain among the ranks of Kyiv's military.

title.children: Russian forces threaten supply lines of stretched Ukrainian army

image.altText: The ASX building exterior.

props.synopsis: The ASX is likely to recover some of yesterday's heavy losses, the Australian dollar continues to hover near a five-year low of 61.5 US cents, while the Nasdaq sinks after a sharp fall in tech stocks like Nvidia and Meta. Follow live.

title.children: ASX to recover, Nasdaq sinks as Nvidia leads Wall Street's tech sell-off

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Macau businessman revealed to be Star Entertainment's second largest shareholder
Casino operator Star Entertainment 'on its knees' as analyst predicts looming financial collapse
ASX to recover slightly, Nvidia and tech stocks drag Nasdaq lower

image.altText: A graphic showing various internet imagery and Australia

props.synopsis: Labor is seeking to restore Kevin Rudd's original vision for the troubled NBN, but it has thorny issues to confront as internet customers look elsewhere.

title.children: Will Labor's NBN cash injection make your internet faster?

image.altText: Courtney Mills performing as a DJ.

props.synopsis: A Melbourne DJ is being remembered as a "sparkling" and "joyful" person after her death in Bali on Sunday.

title.children: Family remembers 'magnificent' Melbourne woman after Bali death

props.synopsis: Around the clock coverage of news events as they break at home and abroad.

title.children: ABC News Channel live

image.altText: An elderly woman with white wavy hair and glasses wears a blue dress with a white flower on her lapel and sits in a home.

props.synopsis: Police are renewing their calls for help to find a man who attacked an elderly widow in her Melbourne home twice in two years.

title.children: DNA evidence used in cold-case hunt for man behind Melbourne sex assaults

image.altText: An image of a colourful reef with starfish and various deep sea creatures

props.synopsis: From red urchins to orange sea cucumbers, researchers monitoring the fastest-melting glacier in East Antarctica are surprised by new-found biodiversity under the ice at Bunger Hills.

title.children: Scientists discover 'thriving' marine life beneath Antarctic ice

image.altText: Queen Elizabeth berthing.

props.synopsis: The Queen Elizabeth's arrival has been made possible by a major port expansion but business owners fear the state of the CBD will leave its 2,000 passengers with a sour taste.

title.children: Townsville to welcome biggest-ever cruise ship to 'embarrassing' CBD

image.altText: A police van blocks entrance to a road.

props.synopsis: Four people are killed in a head-on crash involving a taxi and a station wagon, with police believing the driver who caused it intentionally drove on the wrong side of the road.

title.children: Driver made 'conscious' choice to drive wrong way down highway, killing four

image.altText: Woman with plait, wearing gym gear exerting herself lifting weights.

props.synopsis: Trying to tone up in the new year? Electrical muscle stimulation is promoted as a way to build strength and lose fat with less effort. We look how the claims stack up with the evidence.

title.children: Is electrical muscle stimulation really a short-cut to getting buff?

image.altText: Rebecca Zentveld holding coffee beans in her hands.

props.synopsis: Bad weather in key coffee producing countries has sent the price of beans soaring but Australian growers say capitalising on gaps in the market will be difficult.

title.children: Australian coffee growers struggle to capitalise as bean price soars

image.altText: Close up of person holding phone in hands. Person wears a silver wrist-watch.

props.synopsis: Social media has many positives: connection, info sharing, photos of your overseas friends' wedding. But when it starts to elicit negative emotions, how do you get off it?

title.children: Quitting social media is hard. Here's how to set yourself up for success

image.altText: woman lays on bed in her underwear with sunlight pouring in

props.synopsis: There are several ways endometriosis can make conceiving harder. But just how prevalent is infertility for people with the disease?

title.children: How likely is endometriosis to impact someone's fertility?

image.altText: A middle-aged white man and woman in orange shirts and black masks are walked by Indonesian police down a roadway.

props.synopsis: An Australian couple held in a Bali jail since October have had their detention "postponed" according to police, amid anger over a newspaper report claiming were released on bail.

title.children: Australian couple accused of running Bali brothel have detention postponed

image.altText: A row of solar panels are stood in the ground above red dirt

props.synopsis: We asked a career expert what 2025 looks like for jobseekers and career changers.

title.children: Green jobs and AI disruption key for job seekers in 2025

image.altText: a truck outdoors suspends a large cylinder

props.synopsis: A company ordered to pay thousands in fines due to the offensive odour from its waste landfill site in Western Sydney is now being lauded for "showing us how to do something sensible with waste".

title.children: New solution for 'rotten egg gas' from Western Sydney landfill

image.altText: A man in grey hair and glasses stands in front of a podium

props.synopsis: British Prime Minister Keir Starmer hopes to use AI to boost efficiency in the public sector from education to detecting potholes.

title.children: UK PM lays out bid to become AI 'world leader', starting with civil servants

image.altText: The gates of Perilya's south mine in Broken Hill open

props.synopsis: An underground fire at a Chinese-owned mine in Broken Hill re-ignites and spreads to multiple levels, as nearby residents are warned to stay inside for their safety.

title.children: Broken Hill mine fire re-ignites, locals warned of possible toxic smoke

image.altText: Artist Hiromi tango wears a colourful striped kimono, and holds a flower petal sculpure in outstretched arms

props.synopsis: Leading Japanese-Australian artist Hiromi Tango creates vibrant artworks exploring the healing possibilities of art, and how creating contributes to mental wellbeing — they're exhibited everywhere from major galleries to health spaces.

title.children: 'Slowing down is really important': Hiromi Tango says her art can help

image.altText: Two people sit on graves. One has 1.5 in orange paint

props.synopsis: The protest was in reaction to recent news that global temperatures in 2024 had exceeded 1.5 Celsius above the pre-industrial era for the first time.

title.children: Climate activists paint on Charles Darwin's grave

image.altText: A close up image of an SA Police car.

props.synopsis: SA Police have urged cyclists who use the bike path running alongside the Southern Expressway to be alert after separate crashes involving fence wire strung across the path.

title.children: Cyclists warned of wire strung across popular Adelaide bike path

image.altText: A woman with brown hair, a pink top and black glasses smiles at the camera through a sea of pink and orange flowers

props.synopsis: More than a decade of teaching has taught Natalie Brock a thing or two, but her biggest life lesson has been to "do something you love".

title.children: Teacher turned florist proves it's never too late for a career change
